definition: square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs govern the accusative case in German.
sentences.chinese: 在德語中，許多及物動詞左右着賓格。

sentences.english: There is a Mr. Bingley arrived from the north.
sentences.chinese: 有個賓格萊先生從北方搬到這兒。

sentences.english: The default case in Russian is nominative.
sentences.chinese: 在英文中預設格是賓格。

sentences.english: You use object pronouns as the direct or indirect object ofa verb.
sentences.chinese: 賓格人稱代詞用作動詞的直接或間接賓語。
高師長有一臺電腦，賓格。

sentences.english: They were to be just hunting dogs before they used guns for the sport.
sentences.chinese: 在用史賓格做槍獵犬之前只是獵犬。

sentences.english: What is the usage of the object forms of pronouns?
sentences.chinese: 代詞爲賓格形式時，有哪些用法？

sentences.english: The default case in English is accusative.
sentences.chinese: 在英文中預設格是賓格。
